name: Dwarfs!?
description: Dig! Dig! Dig! Manage the small underground Dwarf base and make it as rich as possible before they meet their inevitable doom. Purchase before May 11th and save!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP SP2, Vista, or Windows 7Processor: 1.7+ GHz or betterMemory: 1 GBGraphics: DirectX®9-compatibleDirectX®: DirectX®9Hard Drive: 250 MBSound: DirectX®9-compatible

reviews.review_text: Dwarfs!? is a top down casual strategy game where you loosely control dwarves as they tunnel for riches. I played this game for about 2 hours and put it down as I was not particularly compelled to continue. The game isn't terrible; there are certainly far worse out there but the gameplay is just 'OK' to the point where it's not worth playing in my opinion. There are several gamemodes but the main gamemode is called 'Arcade Mode' where you essentially go as long as you can for a high score. This game would be good as a tablet/phone game that I would play on the subway but as a PC game I need more of a reason to play this. Priced at $10, this game is far too expensive for what you get.   Score: 5/10

God damn those dwarfs. think they are all grown in a potato cellar. they love to release water and lava to your dungeon, but the satisfying part is to blow them up with dynamite. pretty casual managing game, with a hint of lemmings. has some addicting qualities. i recommend
Very fun game that gets difficult quickly. It is a nightmare when a dwarf wanders away and finds lava. Multiple game modes make this game even more interesting. 10/10

Good game actually, perfect for killing time. Gets even more interesting on higher difficulties because of more new enemies like Spider Queen and caves with treasures/minerals. And the price is low, totally worth it. Also the other reason to get it is for the Killing Floor to unock Dwarfs?! weapons, they are quite powerfull. EDIT: Before doing stuff in arcade mode, i recommend you to pass the tutorial in the campaign mode, every feature and mechanics of the game will be described there, so you can return already armed and dangerous.
Nothing fancy, just something good to chill out too.

This is probably one of my favorite games on all time. If you like action puzzlers like flight control, droplitz, devil dice, bombastic and miner disturbance you will love this game. Dwarfs!? is nothing like dwarf fortress, the best way i can think to describe is a mixture of flight control and lemmings. Iv had allot of fun competing to positions in the high score board and i know i will continue playing for a long time to come.    The carnival event is the weakest part of the game, it was added a free dlc back before dwarfs was 'f2p', its just a pointless little addition, completely disjointed from the main game (which i consider arcade mode to be the main game) The campaign made serves as a good tutorial but definitely isn't long enough to be a selling point. I had fun with it but its only 10 minutes long. The base defense mode is playable for a an hour or so but is very bare bone, if you have already bought the whole game it can be a bit of fun but i would not recommend buying it separately.    Iv found most of the fun or this game to be chasing a high score in arcade mode, its mostly free of hacked and glitched high scores which is great. There is a few scores at the top which are over 50,000,000 which i obviously glitched or hacked but i can attest that the rest are legit including all of mine where i can be found in the top 10 of most game modes.

[Note: If you're considering this game, I would recommend trying the free-to-play version, which is listed as 'Dwarfs - F2P' on Steam. (This version is the full game; the F2P version allows you to buy individual parts of the game.)]  Dwarfs!? is a strangely addicting game. If you enjoy arcade games, where the main objective is to beat your high score (or someone else's high score), you'll probably love this game.  The way you score is by getting as much gold as you can, while trying to stay alive--but you're dwarfs aren't the brightest and will insist on digging into caves filled with water, lava, and monsters, so you'll have to keep a close eye on them, which becomes harder and harder as the game progresses.  The game has four difficulties which can be played in 5, 15, 30, and 60 min sessions (but beware, you cannot save the game mid-session).  The only problem I've encountered is in long games, where you have thousands of dwarfs in the field at one time, my computer starts to lag--which makes the game very difficult and frustrating to play.  Overall, this is a fun, simple, casual game that can keep you entertained for hours or opened for a quick 5-minute session.

I have played this game for 40 minutes, but the problem is, i haven't played even a BIT. I was trying to play, but crashing all the time after chosing a level. I spent 40 minutes trying to start it, tried to force the game run for different windows versions, tried downloading and installing the programs (which i already had) that the mods posted in the forum, re-installing the game. Nothing! Still crashing all the time.

This poor excuse for a game is quite possibly the worst $4 one could spend this holiday season. You are better off buying 4 dollars of cocaine and consuming it through your ear canal while engaging in violent non-consensual homosexual intercourse. At the end of the day, it does not matter which position you are in because I can guarantee that the visual experience that is 'Dwarfs!?' (appropriately punctuated, I would imagine that the reader is getting anally penetrated while reading the word) is much less pleasing than either of them. I can not possibly express to you the level of masochism required to participate in this visual experience, however the dwarves' constant desire to become engulfed and drown in several common terrestrial liquids should give you at least a hint. Your warriors exhibit extremely debilitating cases of both autism and arthritis, failing to destroy even the most unthreatening shaman. Even telling your dwarves to move or not commit suicide costs massive amounts of currency. You literally have to place explosives and force them to blow themselves into smithereens to prevent them from destroying your own barriers and transforming your entire base into a pile of volcanic mush. Yes, this is an actual game mechanic. If you are still at all interested in this experience, I might also ask if you are interested in the evisceration of your internal organs by your worst enemy after a bad day at work. You will experience approximately the same amount of pain either way, but Dwarfs!? will also cost you 4 dollars. Unless of course you desire the free to play version in which you will also experience internal devastation, but as a filthy casual plebeian.

Fairly easy but with unexpected dilemmas, a few different game modes,. and tutorial voice acted (not always very well done, but A for effort) by yoggscast . Dwarf lemmings run around and get themselves killed. Keep them alive - or send them to their deaths.
I thought this would be a building / exploration sim, but it's actually very arcadey and strange. I couldn't really get in to it, but maybe your mileage may vary.
Great game. The controls are good, there are many different game modes, and the randomly generated dungeons keep the game fresh. 10/10 would reccomend.
The game is pretty pointless in my opinion. You run out of things to do in an hour. It sits in my library as a stark reminder of what steam sales can do to you.
30 hrs by a girlfriend?   8/8 M8 - IGN

I would only recomend to stay away until they remove the cheat keys from the game. I was only by mistake that I found D spawned a dwarf, thinking this was a feature of the game I was using it for a while until my finger slipped and hit the C key. This ended my current game and gave me a 50 million score. I then tried other keys to find that you could get 1 million gold, spawn monsters and defenders. I gave up on playing a short while after. Once you know you can do something, it takes the fun out of it.
It wasn't as good as that game 'Not Playing 'Dwarfs!?'.'  But it was better than 'Let's Buy 'Dwarfs!?'.'
All Play This game It's so beautiful :)
so much fun well worth the money !!!! and sir honeydew
Fantastic little defence game, def lots of interesting modes and catastrophic ending for these lil' ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s

Ugh, is this another mobile game shoveled onto the PC?  This might be interesting as a casual game on a tablet or phone, but PCs have keyboards and mice, which can be useful for tighter levels of game play. I wish that developers would think about how people play on different devices before porting.  What breaks the immersion the most is the voices. I guess these dwarves live under LA...rubs off on them.
i say boe to this game after i went over from the free version to the payed version i lost all my achievements even the 1 i had for killing floor1
DWARFS! there is nothing left to say.
Simple relaxing fun, that is untill you stumble apon lava, for the 40000th time!  (wonderful game!)
I do not like but you can try it.
It's like Dungeon Keeper but only a lot crappier.

Got it in a bundle its fun but after a short time one of your workers dig into 'water' and its so hard to stop and get rid of and when you finaly stop it by placing walls 2 seconds later another dwarf decides to destroy the wall... But if you find away past that the game is good, with it being refreshing every time you play different dungeons and resorces spawn and many game modes with great controls.

Xx360Ex0rtxXNoW3x420Quasit: Is Dwarfs?! good? Bread-Sama: Kinda Xx360Ex0rtxXNoW3x420Quasit: What's it about? Bread-Sama: Dwarves Bread-Sama: that dig holes. Xx360Ex0rtxXNoW3x420Quasit: damn, is that a fun thing to do Bread-Sama: into rock Bread-Sama: and there is water and lava. Xx360Ex0rtxXNoW3x420Quasit: can you die Bread-Sama: if you drown or fall into the lava Xx360Ex0rtxXNoW3x420Quasit: Okay, but is it fun Bread-Sama: I played it like 3 minutes. Bread-Sama: I think it's like 'What did i do to deserve this my lord?' Bread-Sama: If you know it   So I guess the game is meh, so I wont reccomend it because I review games I only played 3 minutes.
i really dislike this game because it is extreamly boring, and anoying. it is not worth the amount of money that it costs.
Get's boring in few hours, as you would like more gamemodes to play. 9/10
Fun little Indie, alright to spend a few hours on. Fast game mechanics and a pick-up-put-down feel to the gme makes it a good filler when theres not much time. Kinda feels like an IOS game

Think lemmings with dwarves... 'Relaxing' fun game for when you're bored or don't feel like playing anything particularly mindwrenching...  Simon from the Yogscast does voice work in this game, so it's definately a WN!
It's basically like lemmings with a view from above, pretty fun game.
So funny and fustrating, that your jaw will kill you.

DISCLAIMER: This was a free code I got from a promotion.  I do not like this game, it's nothing like Dwarf Fortress and if it weren't for OK tower defense minigame, I wouldn't even turn it on.  As it stand I give this game 43/100
Right top.
Horrible game about poorly drawn art, bad voice over, B-grade jokes combined with lifeless mobile/flash looking pile of should-be-free2play crap. It's a great game if you like terrible games.
Dwarfs is a really fun and time consuming game which has the potential to give great map awareness in other games. Managing all the dwarfs in a 1 hour game is not as easy as you might think.
The game's okay and can draw you in, for a few hours. Mainly got it for the Killing Floor Axe

If you like Lemmings, Dungeon kepper and Dwarfs then buy this game. Its about micromanaging suicidal dwarfs digging holes in the earth, trying to keep them alive and score alot of points to brag about. You will die. At least once.
I don't know if I love this game or if I just love the premise of this game, but I've played it a lot and you probably should too.
Best 2.50 game on Steam.
Fantastic, entertaining and fast game with many different mods to keep you 'busy'... Recommended!
one word, Fun ^^ its great to pass the time with this game

It's a fun, semi-casual sort of game - and if you've only got a few minutes available, you can play a complete 5-minute game in Arcade mode! But don't be put off by my term 'semi-casual' - it can get really challenging, trying to control those miners of yours!  Also... it turns out that the 'Diggy Diggy Hole' song from the Yogscast was immortalised in Dwarfs!?, too! :D
This game is a fun time waster, very worth a couple bucks if you can spare it. 7/10

I wrote this off as a crap game at first, but it seems to be genuinely fun. It's got the same addictive quality to it that Lemmings did all those years ago, and with scoreboards, you'll be trying to beat your friends in every way possible. Give it a try!
it's Good
It's a fun game, but not the kind you play 24/7.

Neat little game, wish the ability to control dwarves and the UI were better. It's kinda like: Fighting with UI, the game! If you're looking to buy, don't pay more than $2 for it, it isn't worth more than that.
'Dwarfs!?' Is one of those games which are enjoyable and you play for the sake of playing. A fun little time waster, well in my oppinion anyway.

A unique setting of taking an army of lemmings, with an overseer, random events that happen in all sorts of manners. Small to massive maps under a short to long (infinite) time limit to make the best score you can until the end, and how does it end! Its a great short game, (pun intended) that you can pick up and play anytime, from anywhere.

Really good for a 2D Strategy game about digging holes and blocking up Lava and Water caves and killing waves of enemies and shooting Dwarfs out of Cannon from an Outpost after training them whilst getting Digger Dwarfs to make you some moneh!
Just an amazing game! I havent laughed so much with a game in a long time!  Just Epic It can go from total order to total destruction in few seconds!  4,5/5
